availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Arvin (Taylor County, Kentucky, student and soldier in the 37th KY (USA))

body.p: Taylor County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Edward Arvin and Susanna Arvin. Married to Francis E. Carlile Arvin in Taylor County, Kentucky, on February 15, 1865. Resident in Taylor County in 1850. Student in Taylor County in 1860. Served in Company E 37th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as a First Sergeant from October 24, 1863, to December 29, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, Division 2, p. 149A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Taylor County, p. 544.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 417.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Taylor County Marriages, Film #000983735, p. 22-23.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 375.
"George W. Arvin (1845-1930)," Find A Grave, Memorial #24644566, accessed January 7, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24644566.
